page.title: 13S.Luke's Church-Winmarleigh
page.content: Built in 1876 at a cost o9f Â£2000 to Lord Winmarleigh, this small Victorian Gothic Church of{S.Luke}sits at the centre of the village geographically. In recent years it has lost its total independence and is part of the United Benefice with{S.Michael's,}Cockerham, with whom it shares a vicar,unideally resident in Cockerham. The edifice itself is unexceptional save for an unusual wooden spire and Victorian decoration of the ceiling of the chancel and the walls of the nave. Plaques, recording the works of the chief benefactor and his family, adorn the walls, and, the Bishop's Chair is that of a former Bishop of Soder and Man,an ancestor of Lord Winmarleigh's. The church is at present in the {Deanery of Garstang}but plans are afoot to move to{Lancaster Deanery}as well as join with{Glasson Parish.
